title: The effects of electrical and thermal boundary condition on the simulation of radiofrequency ablation of liver cancer for tumours located near to the liver boundary
abstract: Effects of different boundary conditions prescribed across the boundaries of RFA models of liver cancer are investigated for the case where the tumour is at the liver boundary...

title: Thermal modeling of lesion growth with radiofrequency ablation devices
abstract: Temperature is a frequently used parameter to describe the predicted size of lesions computed by computational models. In many cases, however, temperature correlates poorly with lesion size...

title: Radiofrequency ablation for liver tumors abutting complex blood vessel structures: treatment protocol optimization using response surface method and computer modeling
abstract: To achieve a result of a large tumor ablation volume with minimal thermal damage to the surrounding blood vessels by designing a few clinically-adjustable operating parameters in RFA...

title: Clinical evaluation of in silico planning and real-time simulation of hepatic radiofrequency ablation (ClinicIMPPACT Trial)
abstract: To evaluate the accuracy and clinical integrability of a comprehensive simulation tool to plan and predict RFA zones in liver tumors...

title: Coupled thermo-electro-mechanical models for thermal ablation of biological tissues and heat relaxation time effects
abstract: Thermal ablation is a widely applied electrosurgical process in medical treatment of soft biological tissues. Numerical modeling and simulations play an important role in prediction...

title: PhysRFANet: Physics-guided neural network for real-time prediction of thermal effect during radiofrequency ablation treatment
abstract: RFA is a minimally invasive technique widely used to ablate tumors. This study proposes a physics-guided neural network to predict thermal effects of RFA in real time...

title: Computational Modeling of Thermal Ablation Zones in the Liver: A Systematic Review
abstract: This systematic review identifies and compares computational models for simulating RFA and MWA thermal zones in liver tumors...

title: Probabilistic finite element method for large tumor radiofrequency ablation simulation and planning
abstract: This study proposes a probabilistic FE model to simulate RFA outcomes accounting for uncertainty in tissue properties...

title: Predicting spatio-temporal radiofrequency ablation temperature using deep neural networks
abstract: DNNs are trained on FEM outputs to rapidly predict spatio-temporal temperature patterns during bipolar RFA...

title: An artificial intelligence-assisted framework for fast and automatic radiofrequency ablation planning of liver tumors in CT images
abstract: This study presents a full AI pipeline for automatic RFA planning using CT images, including segmentation and ablation strategy planning...
